definitions.text: marked by a lack of interest
examples: an apathetic audience
the universe is neither hostile nor friendly; it is simply indifferent

definitions.text: showing no care or concern in attitude or action
examples: indifferent to the sufferings of others
indifferent to her plea

definitions.text: (usually followed by `to') unwilling or refusing to pay heed
examples: deaf to her warnings

definitions.text: (often followed by `to') lacking importance; not mattering one way or the other
examples: whether you choose to do it or not is a matter that is quite immaterial (or indifferent)
what others think is altogether indifferent to him

definitions.text: fairly poor to not very good
examples: has an indifferent singing voice
has indifferent qualifications for the job

definitions.text: having only a limited ability to react chemically; chemically inactive
examples: inert matter
an indifferent chemical in a reaction

definitions.text: marked by no especial liking or dislike or preference for one thing over another
examples: indifferent about which book you would give them
was indifferent to their acceptance or rejection of her invitation

definitions.text: characterized by a lack of partiality
examples: a properly indifferent jury
an unbiasgoted account of her family problems
an indifferent performance
a gifted painter but an indifferent actor
her work at the office is passable
a so-so golfer
feeling only so-so
prepared a tolerable dinner
a tolerable working knowledge of French

definitions.text: neither too great nor too little
examples: a couple of indifferent hills to climb
